title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Exclusive: Famed protein structure competition nears end as NIH grant money runs out
items.description: Agency silent on funding renewal for contest that inspired creation of AIs that predicted how proteins would fold

items.title: Researchers claim their AI model simulates the human mind. Others are skeptical
items.description: Cognitive scientists question new Centaur model’s ability to predict human behavior

items.title: Should grant applicants judge competitors’ proposals? Unorthodox approach gets two real-world tests
items.description: Distributed peer review enlists more researchers in the process, but some may lack expertise

items.title: Methane tracker lost in space
items.description: For nearly 15 months, MethaneSAT helped pinpoint industrial emissions of potent greenhouse gas

items.title: Devices that pull water out of thin air poised to take off
items.description: Research “explosion” feeds tech that could cool data centers and slake the thirst of soldiers on the move

items.title: These tiny lasers are completely edible
items.description: Edible sensors made of glowing droplets could improve food and drug monitoring

items.title: EPA employees accuse Trump officials of undermining the agency’s mission
items.description: “Declaration of Dissent” denounces partisan messaging, rollback of environmental regulations, and dismantling of science office, among other concerns

items.title: Scientists identify culprit behind biggest-ever U.S. honey bee die-off
items.description: USDA research points to viruses spread by pesticide-resistant mites, indicating a worrying trend

items.title: Scattershot vaccination fails to slow mpox spread in Congo
items.description: Limited vaccine doses weren’t used strategically, WHO analysis finds

items.title: How do research careers compare across countries? New global database has some answers
items.description: Online tool from the Research and Innovation Careers Observatory allows users to compare salary, typical career destinations, and more
